intro: Alkanna confusa, commonly known as the Indian madder, is a flowering plant native to the Indian subcontinent. It is characterized by its erect, branched stems and clusters of small, pinkish-white flowers. The plant produces a red-orange dye from its roots, which has been historically used in textile dyeing. It thrives in dry, well-drained soils and is often found in grasslands and rocky areas. Alkanna confusa is valued both for its ornamental qualities and its traditional uses in natural dyeing processes.
